comment.author: 47393018@N00
comment._content: Ralph "Socks" Seybold (November 23, 1870 - December 22, 1921) is a former professional baseball player. He was an outfielder and first baseman over parts of 9 seasons with the Cincinnati Reds and Philadelphia Athletics. In 1902, he led the American League in home runs while playing for Philadelphia. He was born in Washingtonville, Ohio and died at the age of 51 in an automobile accident in Greensburg, Pennsylvania. en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Socks_Seybold
